rules.prover9_expression: (appealed(facility1, fda_decision1) | (-(failed_test(lab1, quality_check1) -> investigated(facility1, quality_check1)) -> fined(fda, facility1)))
rules.natural: Provided that facility1 appeals fda_decision1, or if it is not the case that failing test quality_check1 by lab1 leads to facility1 being investigated for quality_check1, then the FDA fines facility1.
Whenever patients1 report adverse effects from drug1, the medical board requires a recall of drug1.

Given that the FDA monitors facility1, and if it is not the case that requiring a recall of drug1 by the medical board implies drug1 is unsafe, then the FDA conducts an emergency inspection of facility1.
Provided that facility1 suspends operations, it is not penalized.
If manufacturing process1 is compliant, then the FDA approves drug1.
Either manufacturing process1 is compliant or lab1 is certified.
Under the condition that lab1 is certified, and if it is not the case that producing drug1 by facility1 leads to drug1 being marketable, then drug1 is recalled.
If drug1 is unsafe, then it is not contaminated.
If facility1 is investigated for quality_check1, then drug1 is unsafe.
If the FDA does not monitor facility1, then facility1 is penalized.
Whenever drug1 is not marketable, patients1 report adverse effects from drug1.
Under the condition that drug1 is not marketable, drug1 is contaminated.
Provided that drug1 is not marketable, lab1 fails test quality_check1.

facts.natural: It is not the case that the FDA fines facility1.
It is not the case that facility1 appeals fda_decision1.
It is not the case that the FDA conducts an emergency inspection of facility1.
It is not the case that drug1 is recalled.
It is not the case that the FDA approves drug1.

steps.natural: Either the FDA approves drug1, or if it is not the case that producing drug1 by facility1 leads to drug1 being marketable, then drug1 is recalled.
Under the condition that it is not the case that producing drug1 by facility1 leads to drug1 being marketable, drug1 is recalled.
If facility1 produces drug1, then drug1 is marketable.
Provided that it is not the case that failing test quality_check1 by lab1 leads to facility1 being investigated for quality_check1, the FDA fines facility1.
Provided that lab1 fails test quality_check1, facility1 is investigated for quality_check1.
Whenever lab1 fails test quality_check1, drug1 is unsafe.
If drug1 is not marketable, then drug1 is unsafe.
If drug1 is not marketable, then it is not contaminated.
It is not the case that facility1 is penalized.
If it is not the case that requiring a recall of drug1 by the medical board implies drug1 is unsafe, then the FDA conducts an emergency inspection of facility1.
If the medical board requires a recall of drug1, then drug1 is unsafe.
Under the condition that patients1 report adverse effects from drug1, drug1 is unsafe.
If drug1 is not marketable, then drug1 is unsafe.
If drug1 is not marketable, then it is not contaminated.

natural_facts.A12: Patients1 report adverse effects from drug1.
natural_facts.A13: The medical board requires a recall of drug1.
natural_facts.A14: The FDA conducts an emergency inspection of facility1.
